short_message: In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here
message:
In this era of entrepreneurship and startups, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its responsibility to share some of the successful startup stories. Here we present to you the story of Mr. Arijit Ray, Co-Founder & Managing Partner at PAPERBOAT BRANDWORKS. We got a chance to interact with him during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organized by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur. He is a 1992 batch graduate from Delhi University.
Arijit is a proven Marketing and Advertising Professional with 24 years of experience across various domains with leading multi-national agencies like Rediffusion Y&R, McCann Erickson, Dentsu, DDB Mudra, Saatchi & Saatchi. Arijit started his entrepreneurial journey at Paperboat Brand works recently after he moved on from Dentsu Communications. Where he led the agency over 2 years as CEO and oversaw its journey to acquire 14 new businesses, expand across geographies and become the fastest growing agency of the Dentsu Network globally.
Paperboat Brandworks, a creative communications company striving to understand brands in the new era, to offer smart, effective and memorable creative solutions across the spectrum. With a collective experience, ARIJIT RAY along with his partners bring to the table a very potent fusion of strategic, creative & business capabilities that are relevant to solve and add values to the complex communication and marketing problems of brands in this new age. Paperboat effortlessly works on all kinds of media from print to outdoor to electronic to digital and offer end-to-end integrated creative solutions that are relevant to your brand and category.

message:

Arijit is a proven Marketing and Advertising Professional with 24 years of experience across various domains with leading multi-national agencies like Rediffusion Y&R, McCann Erickson, Dentsu, DDB Mudra, Saatchi & Saatchi. short_message: The word 'rape' itself sounds so vicious and that too of an eight-month-old girl is barbaric and shameful. The incident happened in New Delhi on 28th January
message:
The word 'rape' itself sounds so vicious and that too of an eight-month-old girl is barbaric and shameful. The incident happened in New Delhi on 28th January when the girl, whom we are referring to as Chhutki, became the victim of the most monstrous act that a 28-year-old cousin can do. She was raped and left abandoned in a pool of her own blood. The child's father is employed as a daily wage labourer, while her mother works as a domestic help in the houses nearby.
Chhutki needs extensive medical support, and The Quint, in association with BitGiving, has launched a crowdfunding campaign for the infant that can support the poor family through the tough times.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students, faculty, and staff of IIT Kharagpur to contribute their bit so that Chhutki may lead a life of dignity after she gets well.
#HelpChhutki Win This Fight

To contribute to crowdfunding, Please visit: https://www.bitgiving.com... or https://www.thequint.com/...

short_message: As promised in the Union Budget 2018 in what can be considered to be a significant step in promoting research in premier institutions of the country, the
message:
As promised in the Union Budget 2018 in what can be considered to be a significant step in promoting research in premier institutions of the country, the application forms for the Prime Minister Research Fellowship will be available on the newly launched portal www.pmrf.in from 24th February 2018.

Selected Candidates will be offered admission to Ph.D. program in one of IITs/IISc with a fellowship of Rs.70,000/- per month for the first two years, Rs.75,000/- per month for the 3rd year, and Rs.80,000/- per month in the 4th and 5th years. Apart from this, a research grant of Rs.2.00 lakh per year will be provided to each of the Fellows for a period of 5 years to cover their academic contingency expenses and for foreign/national travel expenses. The fellowship scheme aims at attracting the talent pool of the country to promote research in IITs and IISc.

Final year or graduate students enrolled from 4-year or 5-year courses in Science and Technology streams from IISc/IITs/NITs/IISERs and centrally funded IIITs with CGPA above 8.0 are eligible for applying for the fellowship. For more information, please visit the portal www.pmrf.in

short_message: In a third-party audit of some top educational institutions of the country conducted by Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI), all campus
message:
In a third-party audit of some top educational institutions of the country conducted by Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI), all campus kitchens except for those in IIM Ahmedabad and IIT Roorkee failed to pass the audit. While IIT Kharagpur wasn't on the radar of auditors, IISc, Bangalore; AIIMS (Delhi, Jodhpur); IISER, Kolkata; IIMs (Ahmedabad, Kozhikode); and IITs (Mumbai, Guwahati, Delhi, Chennai, Roorkee and Kanpur) were the ones where kitchens were thoroughly examined for parameters like cooking area's maintenance, use of safe utensils/equipment, maintenance and sanitation, personal hygiene etc.
Rodent droppings in kitchens, overflowing sinks, pest infestations, unnetted drains, and storing food/ raw materials on the floor, water stagnation around sink area, choked/non-functional bathrooms for the staff, using food storage areas as changing rooms by staff were some of the common issues that auditors found in the kitchens which performed poorly in the audit.

Source: https://www.newsbytesapp....

short_message: The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) here, has started an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently, to provide legal
message:
The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) here, has started an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently, to provide legal service to the needy and enable legal literacy. The faculty and students of the school will run legal aid and IP facilitation camps on Saturdays in order to provide assistance to whoever may require it, institute officials said. 'Access to legal aid is still a problem in Indian society, especially in rural areas.

In many cases, a legal step is simple but people hesitate to take it,' Professor Padmavati M, Dean of the IIT-Kharagpur Law School said. In many cases, good legal advice can lead to expedite solutions, she said. 'Sometimes it is even necessary to avoid long legal wrangles and take immediate action,' she said. In marital cases, too, timely legal advice may lead to early resolution, she said. 'When we enable the mechanism of legal aid to the village sarpanch or panchayat leader - peoples' first level of contact with authority - the people are already enabled. This is the reason why the legal aid cells plan of spreading legal literacy is so important,' she said. The cell will also provide assistance on cyber issues, assist in the protection of indigenous crafts and other areas where its expertise in intellectual property rights needed, she said. A significant activity of the cell would be to provide intellectual property rights (IPR) protection service, especially where its expertise is required in building a case for GI and registering it, she added. Geographical indication (GI) is a unique case which is directly related not just to one artisan but to the communities that use local resources for sustenance of livelihoods, the professor said. Apart from this, the law school has plans to create a group of paralegal volunteers who will work with the district legal services. Professor Padmavati hoped that the cell would eventually go online to provide legal assistance to a larger number of people. Justice Aniruddha Bose, Judge, Calcutta High Court and Executive Chairman, West Bengal Legal Services, inaugurated the cell earlier this month. The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) in IIT-Kharagpur is a unique law school that was set up in 2006 with the help of a distinguished alumnus Vinod Gupta to groom the scientists and engineers into intellectual property lawyers. The law school offers a three-year LLB program with specialisation in intellectual property law (IPL) recognised by the Bar Council of India, the LLM program in various disciplines of law and a doctoral program.

short_message: Just a week ago, the UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio organized a sensitization program for all the freshers wherein there
message:
Just a week ago, the UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio organized a sensitization program for all the freshers wherein there were valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives.
Before the freshers get into their very crucial second year, it's needed to get them acquainted with the facts which will help them in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP.
Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean SA), Prof. Sudhirkumar Barai (Dean, UGS), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG), faculty members from the CDC, HMC and the program officers of EAA were present at the occasion and shared their valuable ideas with the students. Mr. Mayank Srivastava (Vice President, TSG) and Mr. Ksheera Sagar (UG Representative) also put in their efforts to conduct the program.
The Netaji Auditorium was jam-packed and students got benefitted by the valuable advice imparted by the dignitaries. While Prof. Somesh Kumar highlighted the importance of discipline in the KGP life and urged the students to come out and interact with their neighbouring students to know them better, Vice President, TSG has proposed to circulate a query form among students to take questions related to their academic problems.
Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur, a newly formed body has also taken the initiative of a regular 'Random Acts of Kindness' on a daily basis which, for sure, would go a long way in harbouring harmony among the students.

short_message: Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality lab in the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering invited The Scholars' Avenue to showcase their work and
message:
Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality lab in the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering invited The Scholars' Avenue to showcase their work and projects. Established in May 2016 under the mentorship of the Prof Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur, and under the charge of Prof Jhareswar Maiti, Head of Department, Industrial and Systems Engineering, the SAVR Lab has state of the art facilities to carry out research in Virtual Reality. The lab is equipped with the essential tools such as 3D laser scanners, military-grade head-mounted displays, oculus rifts, data gloves, powerful computers, projectors etc. The lab has been sponsored by the Government of India under the Uchhatar Avishkar Yojana (UAY) to promote Virtual Reality research.

Their “hero project”, for all the Elon Musk fans out there, is a Virtual Reality [VR] simulation of SpaceX’s Star-man created by Prateek Srivastava [Third-year undergraduate, Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture].

A team of 10 students including Manorama Jha[research scholar] and Siddharth Jindal [Third-year undergraduate, Department of Mathematics and Computing] led by Prateek and mentored by Mr. Anirban Santara [PhD scholar and a 2015 B.Tech graduate, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications Engineering], who is popular in the Artificial Intelligence community of Kharagpur, are working on the Virtual KGP project, a complete open-source VR simulation of the campus which they hope will help in initiating other projects for development of different VR applications. To aid the completion of the project they intend to organize various hackathons where students will be awarded for adding intricate details. They aim to collaborate with the Urban Planning Department of IIT Kharagpur in making an app which will help regional planners visualize their designs. With Autonomous Ground Vehicle, IIT Kharagpur they plan to create a highly accurate and photorealistic simulation of an autonomous car through an open sourced project- the first of its kind in the world.

The lab has also taken up a project sponsored by Tata Steel to simulate the Electric Overhead Travelling [EOT] Crane in the hope of reducing industrial accidents and improving safety standards. Recognising the scope for research in Virtual Reality in various sectors like education, industry, and entertainment, they are encouraging Virtual Reality research in the campus and are inviting B.Tech and M.Tech students to take up projects in their lab.

The lab invites students to come in small groups to catch a glimpse of their SpaceX's Star-man simulation.

short_message:
Won’t you enjoy playing a counter-strike kind of game which has its landscape based on the KGP campus? We all would love to, Right?
Absolutely breathtaking
message:
Won’t you enjoy playing a counter-strike kind of game which has its landscape based on the KGP campus? We all would love to, Right?
Absolutely breathtaking and exhilarating experience! Yes, that’s what our reporters got when they experienced the high definition Virtual Reality simulation of Kharagpur campus and 'StarMan' driving the Roadster in space, developed by Virtual Reality Laboratory at the Industrial and Systems Engineering, IIT Kharagpur!
They were able to gaze through the enormous space including Earth, Moon, Mars, Sun and asteroids - all through the eyes of the Starman peeking through his window. Seeing planets rotating, passing by and the car just managing to avoid asteroids on its way - witnessing all these sitting in a chair in a small room but feeling as if you were actually an astronaut floating in the space! Getting the same thrilling experience while navigating the entire campus in virtual reality was a visual treat. They were even able to visit Tikka, drink coffee and throw the cup into the dustbin - all through motion sensors and trackers.
Established and conceived in 2016 with the coordination of Partha P Chakrabarti (Director IIT Kharagpur), current Head of the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering Jhareswar Maiti and professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering Pabitra Mitra, this Virtual Reality laboratory got functional from May, 2016. It boasts of state-of-art world-class hardware and software facilities for 3D modelling, projection, navigation and tracking.
While Prateek Srivastava has worked hard on the 'StarMan' project, other enthusiastic students are helping him out in the 'Virtual KGP' project which is going to be completed very soon. And the credit goes to their mentors Anirban Santara and Manorama Jha as well.
We often find out that most of us don't know about various research facilities available in the campus. This is an attempt to let the campus know about the exciting research opportunities that are available in this field of VR and simulation so that more enthusiastic students can join the team and carry forward the awesome work done by the current students.
There are many projects going on currently which include EOT crane accident modelling and simulation, Dumper accident modelling, Accident modelling for open reversible belt conveyor and Hospital fire safety modelling.
We are thankful to the Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality Laboratory for inviting us and demonstrating some mind-blowing simulations!

short_message: The first weekend of this month witnessed an influx of eminent personalities in the fields of business and entrepreneurial ventures thanks to the Global
message:
The first weekend of this month witnessed an influx of eminent personalities in the fields of business and entrepreneurial ventures thanks to the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organised by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur. Among them, Mr.Gulzar Azad was one of the guest speakers invited to share his experiences. We thank them for giving us a chance to interact with him.

Mr. Azad is the present connectivity head of Google India. One look at his profile will speak of his rich experience of working in different kinds of environments and his steady rise. We were glad to have an exciting chat with him on various topics, mainly his iconic RailWire Project, the fruits of which can be seen in the form of free wifi not only here at the Kharagpur Railway Station but all over the country and his experience of working with Google with respect to the entrepreneurial and networking opportunities it opened up for him. He had a lot of interesting things to say on this front and much more.

Check out the link below to share some of his thoughts on several topics ranging from intrepreneurship, free Wi-Fi to how Google shaped him into what he is today.

https://youtu.be/69NctEpzNUI

message: As the Mid Semester examinations are approaching, Central Library will remain open 24X7 from today!

short_message: 'You should surely seek motivation from whatever good others are doing, but never go for comparison as everybody's life is unique and true inspiration
message:
'You should surely seek motivation from whatever good others are doing, but never go for comparison as everybody's life is unique and true inspiration lies within the self.' These are the words of Mr. Gulzar Azad, Country Head of Connectivity, Google India as Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with him. He came to IIT Kharagpur as the chief guest for the opening ceremony of the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018.

He drives Google's initiatives for Internet access and broadband in India. He joined Google India in 2006, with responsibility for launching a range of mobile products and partnerships including Search and Android in emerging markets.

In 2013, Gulzar began working on RailWire WiFi, a partnership initiative between Google and Indian Railways to bring high-speed public Internet access to millions of people visiting train stations across India.

short_message: RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute
message:
RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute as a professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in 1984 and since then he has been one of the most enterprising and enthusiastic faculties on campus, winning numerous best faculty awards and is popular across all the years for his unique way of teaching and empathetic nature towards students.
Before being a professor, Prof Singh has completed his bachelors in Aerospace engineering in 1975, masters in 1977 and Ph.D. in 1982, all three from IIT Kharagpur and has spent 46 years of his life dedicated to this institution. During his stay as a student in KGP, he was a boarder of RK Hall of Residence and enthusiastically participated in extra-curricular activities and was highly active on the social front, too. As a professor, he served as the warden of RK Hall for 7 years. To know more about him, you can read the following article by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur http://awaaziitkgp.org/na... from our 'Know Your Professor' Series.
In his honor, RK Hall will bestow a new award to one of its boarders this year onwards as 'Shri Navtej Singh Trophy'.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Professor Singh a blissful life after retirement.

short_message:
3rd place Play-off || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place Play-off: RP vs NH (Nehru won by 12 runs)
message:
3rd place Play-off || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place Play-off: RP vs NH (Nehru won by 12 runs)

The scores were as follow:
Nehru: 132/8 (20)
RP: 120/10 (19.2)

Batting first, Nehru kept losing wickets at regular intervals. But Arpit, with a contribution of 65 runs from 53 balls, held one end firmly and made sure that they reach a respectable total. Nehru managed 132 runs from their quota of 20 overs. Now it was RP's turn to chase but a poor start surely didn't help their cause. They tried to consolidate their position with a good 3rd wicket-partnership. But, then again losing wickets after regular intervals meant victory slipping away from their hand! Ultimately, they fell short by 12 runs resulting in Nehru's win.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the team for putting up a good fight and the winning team for securing the 3rd place!

short_message:
Finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Final: MMM2 vs AZ (MMM2 won by 1 run in super over)

The scores
message:
Finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Final: MMM2 vs AZ (MMM2 won by 1 run in super over)

The scores were as follow:
Azad- 96/7 (20 overs)
MMM2-96/8 (20 overs)

Super Over: MMM2- 9/1 Azad- 8/1

The cricket final between two extremely dominant sides of the tournament proved to be an absolute thriller. On a mildly sunny day, both the sides played their heart out and dished out a spectacle of a match, to an extent that a super over was needed to decide the winner.

Batting first, Azad's batsmen were kept pretty much in check by the bowlers of MMM yet they managed to score at a steady pace and reached a total of 96 runs. Chasing 97, MMM's batsmen were expected to make through easily but a relentless show by the bowlers from Azad applied brakes on the MMM line up as only three runs were scored in the twelve balls of the 15th and 16th over. At the end of 16 overs, the match looked quite in the balance as MMM needed to score 34 runs off the final 24 balls with 7 wickets in hand. However, MMM smacked a few boundaries in a row to come back into the game. Needing 8 off the final over, there were successive run-outs leading to three runs needed off the final ball. The batsmen scrambled for a double and tied the match at 96 runs.

The match went into the Super Over where MMM batting first, had scored only 1 run off the first three balls with one man down, just then 8 runs came off the next three giving Azad a challenging 10 runs to chase. Azad needed 4 off the final delivery but managed only a double. This meant heartbreak for Azad as they fell short by the narrowest of margins and MMM won the high-intensity final!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for giving their best and the winning team for becoming the champions!

short_message:
Finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games
Final: NH vs LBS (72-65)

In a jam-packed basketball court, LBS
message:
Finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games
Final: NH vs LBS (72-65)

In a jam-packed basketball court, LBS took on Nehru in what was anticipated to be an extremely competitive final. Rightly so, till the last minute game could have gone in anyone's favour! But it was Nehru who held their nerves and came out with flying colours securing a marginal 7 point win over their opponent. Though Nehru maintained the lead throughout but LBS were never out of the game. At the half-time scoreline read 28-34 in favour of Nehru. LBS played their heart out and tried their best to cut down the lead but were always left behind by small margins. Ultimately, Nehru won the final by 72-65.

Individual awards were as follow:-
Best Fresher- Apar Sharma (LBS)
Highest Scorer- Anurag Dhankhar (Nehru)
Best Player of the Tournament- Akash Rathi (Nehru)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a great show and the winning team for their extraordinary performance!

short_message: IIT KGP and AIIMS to come together! 'IIT Kharagpur and AIIMS are planning some unique joint initiatives in academics and research that will open new directions
message:
IIT KGP and AIIMS to come together! 'IIT Kharagpur and AIIMS are planning some unique joint initiatives in academics and research that will open new directions in education and take technology-enabled healthcare directly to the people at large,' said Prof P P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur. Senior professors of both the institutions are in discussion to take the initiatives forward.The collaboration will include strengthening of ongoing activities through collaborative education programmes, research and collaboration for management and analysis of hospital data. Prof Randeep Guleria, Director, AIIMS Delhi, said the medical domain is becoming progressively technology intensive, which puts the matter of IIT Kharagpur providing medical and allied education in perspective.

Source- http://www.business-stand...

short_message:
Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: NH vs AZ (64-57)

In midst of a full house
message:
Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: NH vs AZ (64-57)

In midst of a full house basketball court, the second semifinal witnessed a neck to neck fight between Azad and Nehru. While the first quarter was equally fought and ended with Nehru leading 29-26, it was in the second quarter that Nehru asserted dominance by stretching the lead to 44-32. However, men from Azad were in no mood of bowing down and made a brave fightback in the last quarter reducing the lead to just 49-51, at one point of time. But Nehru held its nerves bringing out the best game under pressure and a flurry of baskets made the score 59-50 in their favour.

Holding on to the lead, the match ended on 64-57 with Nehru making way to what is expected to be a thriller final with LBS.

Also, Azad will be taking on Patel for the third-place playoff.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and wishes the winning team all the best for the finals!

short_message: Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur will join hands with All India Institutes of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to set up the coveted Dr B C Roy Institute
message:
Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur will join hands with All India Institutes of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to set up the coveted Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research — the first medical hospital in an IIT, with an aim to offer medical courses in future.The hospital will start operations by 2018 end. The super speciality hospital will offer consultation in orthopaedic, cardiology and neuroscience.Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research will open with a provision for 400 beds and will be a research-hospital spanning over 42 acres. The hospital will be administered by a registered society with its governing body headed by the director, IIT Kharagpur. The phase I of the project will cost about Rs 400 crore.It is expected that within 2021 IIT-KGP will apply to the Medical Council of India (MCI) to start admission of students, offering MBBS degree.

For more details go through the below link
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-aiims-hospital-to-start-ops-by-year-end/articleshow/62828977.cms

short_message:
आप की राय
Recently, ‘Interaction Rooms’ were introduced by Technology Students’ Gymkhana in almost all the halls of residence. Interaction Rooms
message:
आप की राय
Recently, ‘Interaction Rooms’ were introduced by Technology Students’ Gymkhana in almost all the halls of residence. Interaction Rooms were introduced to provide the students a method to express their problems and issues to others. The concept mainly focussed on reducing the rates of depression in the campus and promoting student welfare. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites the general student community to present their opinions through the poll for this week: ‘Interaction Rooms’. The poll aims to spread awareness about the facility and understand the progress of these rooms.
Please follow the given link and cast your vote:
http://awaaziitkgp.org/po...

short_message: We take pleasure to announce that the Students' Welfare Portfolio of the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur has recently started the Institute
message:
We take pleasure to announce that the Students' Welfare Portfolio of the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur has recently started the Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur.
It is a group of enthusiastic students from all years, disciplines and courses headed by the General Secretaries Students' Welfare of the Gymkhana assisted by the General Secretaries, Students' Welfare of all the halls of residence who shall be responsible to organize events for the improvement of the social culture and general wellness in the campus.
All the activities, workshops and meetings of the IWG are open to the entire KGP community (will be intimated through the facebook page) and everyone is wholeheartedly invited to engage themselves!
Like and Follow the facebook page to get regular updates and to be a part of the process that just began for 'a better KGP!'

short_message:
'People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing. That's why we recommend it daily.'
- Zig Ziglar
Starting the Graph
message:
'People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing. That's why we recommend it daily.'
- Zig Ziglar
Starting the Graph Theory for this semester with one of the most distinctive traits of our breed of engineers, a tradition rooted in the annals of history and followed ardently even today. May there be a time when the art of bathing, or not rather, becomes your badge of honour . Till then here's a something you can refer to.
Does it represent you? Let us know what you think in the comments.

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Badminton

PATEL vs NEHRU
Men's Singles:
Patel defeated Nehru easily in straight
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Badminton

PATEL vs NEHRU
Men's Singles:
Patel defeated Nehru easily in straight sets by 21-7, 21-7.
Men's Doubles:
A good fight by both the players but Patel emerged victorious in straight sets by 21-18, 21-14.

VSRC Vs VS
Men's Singles:
VS defeated VSRC in straight sets by 21-18, 21-13.
Men's Doubles:
VS defeated VSRC by 21-13, 21-18.

LLR Vs RP
Men's singles:
LLR defeated RP in straight sets by 21-14, 21-7.
Men's Doubles:
LLR emerged victorious in straight sets by 21-11, 21-16.

MT Vs VSRC
Women's Singles:
MT defeated VSRC in a one-sided match by 21-6, 21-5.
Women's Doubles:
MT defeated VSRC in straight sets bt 21-10, 21-11.

Azad vs LBS-2
Men's Singles:
Azad defeated LBS-2 in straight sets by 21-6, 21-10.
Men's Doubles:
Azad emerged victorious in two straight sets, defeating LBS-2 by 21-15, 21-16.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams!

Dear UG First year students!
Before you get into your very crucial second year, we would like to remind you about your responsibilities and make you realize some forgotten and harsh facts which will help you in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP.
The UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio is organizing a compulsory sensitization program for all the freshers where in there will be valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives.
Please be on time and follow the seating pattern as shared with you by your EAA officer over mail.
See you all in Netaji at 6pm!

short_message:
Manash Pratim Das shared a post to Aerial Robotics Kharagpur's timeline.

The first test flight of Falcon Heavy is targeted for Tuesday,
message:
Manash Pratim Das shared a post to Aerial Robotics Kharagpur's timeline.

The first test flight of Falcon Heavy is targeted for Tuesday, February 6th at 1:30 PM ET from Launch Complex 39A at Kennedy Space Center in Florida. When Falcon Heavy lifts off, it will be the most powerful operational rocket in the world by a factor of two. For this test flight, Falcon Heavy’s side cores are flight-proven—both previously supported independent Falcon 9 missions in 2016. instagram.com/p/Be1jFT2lQ...

short_message: After series of tests at the CIC Lab, the Technology Transfer Group in association with the Sponsored Research and Industry Consultancy (SRIC) has officially
message:
After series of tests at the CIC Lab, the Technology Transfer Group in association with the Sponsored Research and Industry Consultancy (SRIC) has officially launched the Undergraduate Research Portal today at the Netaji Auditorium. Prof. S K Barai (Dean UGS) and Prof. Sriman Bhattacharya (Deputy Director) were present there along with few other Professors who gave an insight to the research fields and enumerated the research groups developed at IIT Kharagpur. The portal aims at promoting research among Undergrads, who can now apply for projects to work during their summer/ winter vacations. There was a demonstration in which a professor, Dumbledore floats a project topic of research, 'The Sorting Hat Algorithm.' Harry and Draco, the students, apply by filling the form through their student accounts in the portal and uploading a CV. Based on the applications, Draco gets rejected, and Harry selected who then starts to work on the project.
This initiative could tailor young minds towards research, thus bringing about a much-needed evolution in the research culture at IIT KGP.

short_message: French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics
message:
French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.

The last step of this Future Tour will be organized on 17th and 18th February in Ahmedabad on the topic: 'Smart cities: urban planning, architecture, and design'.

Draft program :
Day 1 17th Feb at CEPT :
9 am: Opening session
Two parallel sessions of 4 Round Tables each, one session on Saturday morning (9:30 to 12 am) and the second one on Saturday afternoon (2 to 5 pm). And a networking dinner on Saturday evening at NOVOTEL Ahmedabad.

Day 2 18th Feb at NIRMA University
On Sunday morning there will be some presentations of existing Indo French partnerships as well as a session dedicated to PPP.
Sunday afternoon: one to one meetings between students, alumni, universités, and companies.
Kindly refer to the following links for details about the programme:
https://www.campusfrance....

Around 6-8 people will be invited to each roundtable.

https://drive.google.com/...

Hello everyone,
The Food And Mess Monitoring Committee, IIT Kharagpur is recruiting Associate Members (UG Second years).
Food Monitoring Committee
message:
Hello everyone,
The Food And Mess Monitoring Committee, IIT Kharagpur is recruiting Associate Members (UG Second years).
Food Monitoring Committee and Mess Monitoring Committee is a student body for Regulating and Monitoring Mess & Commercial food Establishments in IIT Kharagpur. Its main objective is to ensure that a standard quality of food is served in all the Mess and the other food outlets inside the campus which ultimately maintains a healthy appetite among the campus community.
Sophomores whoever has a zeal to work for a good cause can register on the link: https://goo.gl/GqiYp7

Time: 6 pm onwards
Date: 7th Feb'18
Venue: Sports Library, Gymkhana

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Badminton

BRH vs VSRC
Men's Singles :
BRH won the match easily, the scoreline
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Badminton

BRH vs VSRC
Men's Singles :
BRH won the match easily, the scoreline reading 21-1, 21-5.
Men's Doubles :
BRH won the match easily in straight sets by 21-13, 21-10.

Patel vs HJB:
Men's Singles:
The player from Patel got injured in the second set when scores were 21-16, 12-7 in the favour of HJB. As a result, HJB was given a walkover.
Men's Doubles :
Despite losing the first set, Patel made a strong comeback winning the match by 15-21, 21-12, 21-16.
2nd Men's Singles:
Patel registered a quite convincing victory in straight sets by 21-3, 21-9.

LBS-1 vs LBS-2:
Men's Singles :
LBS-1 secured an easy win in straight sets by 21-10, 21-8.
Men's Doubles :
LBS-1 faced no tough competition and went on to win by 21-12, 21-11.

MS vs Nehru
Men's Singles :
Nehru won in straight sets, scoreline reading 21-8, 21-8
Men's Doubles :
MS won a hard-fought match by 24-22, 17-21, 21-16.
2nd Men's Singles:
Nehru registered a convincing victory by 21-6, 21-12 over their opponents.

RK vs Azad:
Men's Singles :
Azad won easily in straight sets by 21-9, 21-1.
Men's Doubles :
RK won the match by winning back to back sets by 21-13, 21-16
2nd Singles :
RK won the match easily by 21-14, 21-7.

SN/IG vs VSRC:
Women's Singles :
SN registered an easy victory over their opponents by 21-6, 21-8
Women's Doubles :
SN won the match which went on to the third set by 21-18, 16-21, 21-7.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams!

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Basketball

Quarter-final 2: NH vs RK
NH- 56 pts, RK - 41 pts

The second
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Basketball

Quarter-final 2: NH vs RK
NH- 56 pts, RK - 41 pts

The second quarter-final witnessed a good contest between both the teams. Nehru was trailing by 18-24 till the end of second quarter. But, they made a strong comeback taking a one-point lead at the end of third quarter, the scoreline reading 33-32. After that, they didn't look back and went on to register a win by a margin of 15 points. With this win, Nehru advances to the semi-finals of Basketball!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Rohit Kumar Srivastava and 9 others.

short_message: Bitcoin has been under constant scrutiny ever since it's value appreciated drastically. Experts don't understand if the demand is speculative or sustainable.
message: Bitcoin has been under constant scrutiny ever since it's value appreciated drastically. Experts don't understand if the demand is speculative or sustainable. Recently, the value of Bitcoin took a serious dip. There have been many different reasons being attributed to this decrease. Some point to the Chinese New Year around which time the prices generally see a drop while others contribute this trend to the regulatory barriers set up by countries and even companies such as Facebook and Google. Read on to get a better grasp of the situation.

short_message: Caltech's Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships (SURF) program introduces students to research under the guidance of seasoned research mentors at Caltech
message:
Caltech's Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships (SURF) program introduces students to research under the guidance of seasoned research mentors at Caltech and JPL.

SURF is modeled on the grant-seeking process:

Students collaborate with a potential mentor to define and develop a project
Applicants write research proposals as part of the application process
Faculty review the proposals and recommend awards
Students carry out the work over a 10-week period during the summer
At the conclusion of the program, students submit a technical paper and give an oral presentation at one of several SURF Seminar Days, symposia modeled on a professional technical meeting.
Fellows receive a $6,275 award for the ten-week period. Award payments are distributed in equal installments in late June and late July.
For all further details kindly refer to the following link:
https://www.sfp.caltech.e...

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket
4th Quarter Finals Match: RP vs BRH

RP: 135/7 (20 Overs)
BRH: 133 /9 (20
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket
4th Quarter Finals Match: RP vs BRH

RP: 135/7 (20 Overs)
BRH: 133 /9 (20 Overs)
RP won the match and entered into semi-finals to play against MMM-2.
Earlier, BRH won the toss and chose to field first. RP scored a challenging enough 135 runs in the first innings.BRH players started very well and were in a complete mood of attack. But suddenly, 2 wickets fell in succession getting RP back into the game. The match was balanced throughout further and both the teams were performing well against each other. The last over of the match brought no less thrill to the show. BRH was in need of 10 runs with 2 wickets in hand. 5 runs were scored within the first two balls putting RP under pressure. Third delivery went dot and two singles came in another two balls. Finally, BRH was to score 3 runs in the last ball of the match. The last shot in desperate attempt went all in but was caught at the boundary and with this, RP advanced to the semis.

Here are the two matches to be held in semi-finals:
RP vs MMM2
Azad vs Nehru

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team wishes all the best to the players who will be playing in the semi-finals.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Jacob Blessings and Kaushal Jakhete.

short_message: Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) in association with Technology Transfer Group (TTG) IIT Kharagpur, has created the UG Research Portal
message: Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) in association with Technology Transfer Group (TTG) IIT Kharagpur, has created the UG Research Portal (UGP) and it is going to be launched on 6th Feb, (7.15 pm), at Netaji Auditorium. The purpose of this portal is to engage UG students in research projects. This is an initiative to shape the budding minds of our institute for high-quality research and to foster the research culture among the UG students.

short_message: Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) in association with Technology Transfer Group (TTG) IIT Kharagpur, has created the UG Research Portal
message: Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) in association with Technology Transfer Group (TTG) IIT Kharagpur, has created the UG Research Portal (UGP) and it is going to be launched on 6th Feb, (6.00pm to 7.30 pm), at Netaji Auditorium. The purpose of this portal is to engage UG students in research projects. This is an initiative to shape the budding minds of our institute for high-quality research and to foster the research culture among the UG students.

short_message:
“When opportunity presents itself, don’t be afraid to go after it.”
And keeping this in mind, there has been no looking back from the time we got
message:
“When opportunity presents itself, don’t be afraid to go after it.”
And keeping this in mind, there has been no looking back from the time we got started. Following the streak of showcasing our enthusiasm and zeal for erudition and moulding our ideas into innovative products, our product Evapo - Reefer was announced as the winner of Product Design Idea Competition conducted in Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 by E-Cell, IIT Kharagpur on 3rd February, 2018.The product was aimed to improve the life of consumable commodities during transportation and to reduce food wastage in supply chain by designing a power efficient cold storage transportation system. We congratulate the team for adding another feather in their beret !
story: ProDex is with Naveen Nagar and 7 others.

short_message:
Have you ever gone to ask for a project, but got your request declined because the professor was already too occupied?
Have you ever been in a situation
message:
Have you ever gone to ask for a project, but got your request declined because the professor was already too occupied?
Have you ever been in a situation in which you were asked to come up with a problem statement for the project, but you just couldn't do it?
Have you ever had an idea that you wished you could pursue as a project, but couldn't find that one suited professor?
UG Portal is the perfect platform to apply and plan for projects. The launch is planned on 6th February at Netaji Auditorium from 7:15 pm onwards. Be there to witness the unveiling of a platform that will revolutionize the research culture in the campus.

short_message: The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program
message: The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program for Women 'Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)' (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine).The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in the U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities.The deadline for submission of applications is 28 th February 2018. This is a great opportunity for Indian women students to gain ground in their respective research areas. IR cell encourages all eligible Kgp’ians to make use of the opportunity. For more info, refer to the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_bp-e8GQDAvODL7bvffbraVmeqAuXdC/view?usp=sharing

short_message: In 1999, after working for more than 8 technology companies, he decided to start his own venture, and ultimately went on to become the maker of more than
message:
In 1999, after working for more than 8 technology companies, he decided to start his own venture, and ultimately went on to become the maker of more than 10 startups since then. After retirement, he wrote a book which launched the lean startup movement. In 2013, Forbes listed him under the 30 most influential people in tech., with a net worth of $2.5 Billion! Popularly called as one of the Godfathers of the silicon valley, Steve Blank is a personality worth admiring!
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 on 4th February, 9:30 AM.
#GES2k18

short_message: A recent notice of an office order banning the sales/consumption/distribution of any form of tobacco products in the institute (https://www.facebook.com/awaaziitkgp/photos/a.146211918732505.22874.146188872068143/1728416217178726/?type=3&theater)
message:
A recent notice of an office order banning the sales/consumption/distribution of any form of tobacco products in the institute (https://www.facebook.com/awaaziitkgp/photos/a.146211918732505.22874.146188872068143/1728416217178726/?type=3&theater) created a wave among the students of the campus. A few days have passed since then, but there does not seem to be a change in the conditions even now.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites articles from the general student body under the series of ‘Your Perspective’ for the topic ‘Relevance and Efficacy of Ban on Tobacco Products in the Institute’. Articles can be mailed to our email id: editor@awaaziitkgp.org. Articles may be submitted by next Sunday.
Use of any type of slang words is discouraged in the article.
Also, please provide your name, roll number and hall in the article. Articles, however, can be published anonymously if requested.

short_message:
Quarter Finals | Cricket | General Championship 2017-18 | Sports and Games |

Quarter-final 3: NH vs JCB (20)

The third quarter-final
message:
Quarter Finals | Cricket | General Championship 2017-18 | Sports and Games |

Quarter-final 3: NH vs JCB (20)

The third quarter-final was just the match that we would like to pay for watching. JCB won the toss and elected to bat first. After putting a decent total of 138 runs, it was Nehru's turn to chase. The match was equally balanced till the last over when Nehru needed 8 runs off the final over. That was not all, Ramakrishna brought down the gap to 6 runs needed in two balls. But, Nehru's batsman Vishwanth Teja had some other ideas! He scored a boundary off the 5th ball and sprinted for a couple on the final ball to go past JCB's total of 138 runs defeating them by 5 wickets.

The scores were as follow:
JCB: 138/7 (20)
NH: 139/5 (20)
With this win, NH advances to the Semi-finals of Cricket. For further updates, stay tuned to our page.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for their upcoming match!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyansh Shah and Mihir Sampat.

short_message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavors to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavors to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to be implemented in near future to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

short_message:
||New Micro-Credit Course||
Ever wondered how will our world or country look like in terms of medical technology or healthcare services? What would
message:
||New Micro-Credit Course||
Ever wondered how will our world or country look like in terms of medical technology or healthcare services? What would be the role of emerging new technologies (e.g. ML/AI) in the development and transformation of the field? Are we ready for the upcoming challenges?
Get an opportunity to listen directly from Professor Michael Friebe, a Distinguished Lecturer of the IEEE EMBS. He is an active contributor to this field through his research works & entrepreneurial skills and specialises in diagnostic imaging & image-guided therapies.

Professor M. Friebe is offering a 1 credit (additional) course named “INNOVATION, DISRUPTION, AND EXPONENTIAL DEVELOPMENT IN MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES”.
The interested students must apply for this course through ERP by today only. The registration portal along with the syllabus and schedule can be found here: ERP>Academic>Students>Micro-Credit Registration.

For any query, contact Prof. P. K. Dan (pkdan@see.iitkgp.ernet.in) or Dr. Bhaskar Bhowmick (bhaskar@see.iitkgp.ernet.in).

short_message: Nanyang Technological University, Singapore hosts The NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme which is a university-wide short-term research programme
message:
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore hosts The NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme which is a university-wide short-term research programme that lasts for 2 to 6 months.Students of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field, experience multicultural living, gain a network of friends and a better understanding of Singapore.

Eligible students may be given an allowance and are expected to fulfil a minimum of 2 months research attachment involving research project work at NTU. Student will also receive a certificate issued by NTU-India Connect office upon completion of the programme.

Please read the following important note before applying:​

Internship Period

NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 will fall within the following periods:-

Batch 1 (3rd January 2018 to 1st June 2018)
Batch 2 (8th May 2018 to 13th July 2018)
Batch 3 (1st August 2018 to 31st December 2018)
​​For Batch 1 and 3, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 5 months.
For Batch 2, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 2 months.

Application Period
The opening and closing dates for NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 is stated below.

Batch 1 (15th July 2017 to 31 August 2017)
Batch 2 (1st November 2017 to 31st December 2017)
Batch 3 (1st February 2018 to 31st March 2018)​

Eligibility Criteria
Open to Pre-final year graduates / undergraduates who have not studied in NTU previously.

​​Qualification ​Duration ​Eligible period ​
B Tech / B.Sc. (Degree)
​4 years Pre-final year - End of 3rd year​
​M Tech / M.Sc. (Master) ​2 years Pre-final year - End of 1st year​​
​M + B / M.Sc. + B.Sc.
(Dual Degree)​ ​5 years ​Pre-final year - End of 4th year​​
Students must possess good academic track records.
M​ust be a student pursuing his / her studies in an Indian University / Institute of higher learning upon the period of his / her internship with NTU.
Students that meet the minimum requirement with scholarships, publication and internship experiences will be given preference.​​
For all further details about the application procedure and other details,kindly visit: http://global.ntu.edu.sg/...

short_message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in
message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. It was a very fruitful discussion between the deans and the student representatives of the IITs. Alongside SPARC - Students' PAN IIT Alumni Relations Cell also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.
story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.

short_message:
Update on MCM Scholarship

A significant chunk of the student population of IIT Kharagpur receives the Merit-cum-means scholarship and this
message:
Update on MCM Scholarship

A significant chunk of the student population of IIT Kharagpur receives the Merit-cum-means scholarship and this year the recipients have not yet received their scholarship amount. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had earlier reported the reason for the delay (See post- https://www.facebook.com/... ).

We found out that out of about 600 recipients, about 50-60 recipients have not updated their correct bank account details in the ERP despite several requests by the Institute, as a result of which, no one has yet received the MCM scholarship amount to their credit.

One of our Executive Editors had a thorough meeting with the Officiating Deputy Registrar, Mr. Sarbeswar Nayak, regarding the withholding of the scholarship amount of those who have already submitted their details. Those students are not at all supposed to suffer due to the irresponsible behaviour by some of the students. The meeting concluded with the Officiating Deputy Registrar giving assurance that the students who have successfully updated their details will receive the scholarship amount in their bank accounts very soon, as the transaction is under process.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students who have not updated their details with the ERP, to update them as soon as possible, as it creates hurdles in such crucial processes.

message: An important announcement by the board members has marked a new milestone for the IRCell by appointment of a new Dean to oversee all our activities. short_message: Contributing to a child's smile is one of the noblest things to do! Don't you want to be one of the contributors? We all still crave for the feeling we
message:
Contributing to a child's smile is one of the noblest things to do! Don't you want to be one of the contributors? We all still crave for the feeling we got playing in our school playgrounds or the grounds near our house. The lessons learnt in these playgrounds cannot be taught in any classroom. The open ground removes all the boundaries from a child’s actions giving him the freedom to grow in all dimensions both mentally and physically. Apart from all these benefits let us not forget the unparalleled fun on the swings and slides!

Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Chapter is collaborating with Anthill Creations, started by IIT KGP alumni, where they make playgrounds for children in a unique way by using cost-effective practices such as industrial waste and localized sourcing techniques. They want your support for building a playground for the children of Amlatoria School to ensure that all children have fun and excitement in their lives. Currently, the Amaltoria School does not have a playground. CRY and Anthill Playscapes hope to raise INR 1,25,000 for their motive to spread smiles and cheerfulness for children and make the world a better place for children.
Support them here:
https://anthillcreations....

short_message: In an effort to brighten up the lives of less fortunate children, the IIT Kharagpur chapter of CRY has joined forces with Anthill Playscapes, started by
message:
In an effort to brighten up the lives of less fortunate children, the IIT Kharagpur chapter of CRY has joined forces with Anthill Playscapes, started by an IIT KGP alumnus, which focuses on making playgrounds for children in a unique way by using cost-effective practices such as industrial waste and localized sourcing techniques.

The collaboration of CRY and Anthill wants to ensure that all the children have fun and excitement in their lives and therefore they are hoping to raise INR 1,25,000 to support the kids from the Amlatoria school, one of their adopted schools from a nearby village. They do not have a playground right now and the amount you donate will go in giving the children a playful and memorable childhood.

Please click the following link to donate and know more.

https://anthillcreations....

short_message:
IR Cell, IIT Kharagpur is exhilarated with student’s response for application of foreign internship at the Foreign Training Portal.

The students
message:
IR Cell, IIT Kharagpur is exhilarated with student’s response for application of foreign internship at the Foreign Training Portal.

The students are kindly requested to take a note of the following points:-

1. The deadline of application for the first series of project has been extended to 31st of January, 6:00 P.M. (IST). No further extension will be done under any circumstances.

2. The students can apply with a CV specific to the project. The students have to register with one single CV, however, the student may upload a new CV specific to the project in the “apply now” tab. This new CV (if uploaded) will be shared with the concerned professor for application.

3. Both UG and PG students can apply for the projects on the portal. If a student is facing difficulties with any part of the application process, he/she may reach out to us at:-

irc@iitkgp.ac.in

4. The students are requested to keep checking our Facebook page and the portal for new projects to apply.

The link to the portal is:-

http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

For any queries, please contact

Shubham Arora
9800364888

short_message: Another proud moment for all KGPians. Our Alumnus of 2011 batch, Mr. Siddartha Khastgir has been named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry
message:
Another proud moment for all KGPians. Our Alumnus of 2011 batch, Mr. Siddartha Khastgir has been named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry. Mr. Khastgir is currently a Ph.D. Researcher at the University of Warwick where his research is focused on developing new methods and knowledge necessary to test driverless cars to ensure their dependability and to make them commercially viable and is consequently accelerating their introduction. He is also a UK Representative to the ISO Technical Committee for developing international standards in the field of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Automated Driving (AD).
His passion for automobiles first came to notice when he founded TeamKART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur, the first ever Formula Student/SAE project at IIT Kharagpur. Through his talent and dedication, he got the first breakthrough when he procured a funding of INR 1 million from the Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) IIT Kharagpur. This was the largest funding ever by IIT for a student-led project. Mr. Khastgir has also been awarded the TechWorks Young Engineer Under 30 Award 2017. Through his hard work fuelled by the right amount of enthusiasm, he becomes an inspiration for the youth all over the country.
https://www.forbes.com/pr...

short_message: Imagine a four year old kid tiptoeing his way to the top of a car window with mojhris in his hand at a traffic signal. Who would have thought that the
message:
Imagine a four year old kid tiptoeing his way to the top of a car window with mojhris in his hand at a traffic signal. Who would have thought that the same kid would introduce E-commerce in India in 1997, years before the industry flourished. Later, in 2004, he founded Palador Pictures- which went on to become one of the largest libraries of World Cinemas. Selling Mojhris was probably his first entrepreneurial venture!
Be a part of Mr. Gautam Shiknis' talk on 'Accessing Capital to Global Markets' during the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February!
#GES2k18

short_message: Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have
message:
Cryptocurrencies, popularly called as Money 2.0, are all set to bring in a revolution in the Financial Market. But veterans like Warren Buffett have cautioned us to stay away from this Blockchain based currency.
Lately, there has been a huge infusion of money into Bitcoins and altcoins, but the volatility in the cryptocurrency market has resulted into numerous administrations banning the use of cryptocurrencies. Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you a session where experts from India and abroad will clear all the myths about cryptocurrencies, trading patterns, and the future of the highly speculated form of currency!
Date: 02:30PM
Time: 03-02-2018
Veunu: Kalidas Auditorium
story: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur added an event.

short_message: TSG takes this opportunity to invite all the members of IIT KGP community to Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat celebrations, an initiative by the MHRD, Government
message:
TSG takes this opportunity to invite all the members of IIT KGP community to Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat celebrations, an initiative by the MHRD, Government of India, in our campus premises on 30 and 31 Jan 2018.

Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat initiative is aimed at celebrating the diverse linguistic, cultural and religious traditions that hold together our composite national identity.
This is an initiative to narrow down distances in terms of connect and communication and bring about an amalgamation of cultures from different spectrums of our society. Tamil Nadu and Jammu & Kashmir will be presenting before you their cultural heritage.

It begins today at 4:00 pm in Kalidas auditorium..

short_message: The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! The team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Harsh Agarwal won the 'India Quiz' in the recently concluded
message:
The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! The team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Harsh Agarwal won the 'India Quiz' in the recently concluded Nihilanth - the Annual Inter IIT-IIM Quiz championship. After registering a thunderous sweeping win in Inter IIT Cultural Meet, their juggernaut went on to register one more victory against a formidable team of IIM Ahmedabad. Last year, they had finished last in the finals of India Quiz but they made amends for the same in the 15th edition of Nihilanth, hosted by IIM Ahmedabad from January 25-28, 2018. What makes this win more special is that they got past over mighty IIM Ahmedabad team to finish at the top.
This championship featured over seven quizzes for the institutes to slug it out for the coveted championship with the active participation of 450+ students from over 39 contingents (19 IITs, 20 IIMs). As far as overall rankings are concerned, IIT Madras was looking all set to win the championship for record 5th time in a row but was denied by a late comeback by hosts IIM Ahmedabad. IIM Ahmedabad bagged the championship and IIT Kharagpur finished joint 6th ahead of IIM Lucknow, IIT Kanpur and IIM Bangalore.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the participants for their wonderful performance!

short_message: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur conducted the Demo Day of Kharagpur Angel Network at Matrix Partners India Office in Bangalore recently. The event
message:
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur conducted the Demo Day of Kharagpur Angel Network at Matrix Partners India Office in Bangalore recently. The event gave five shortlisted startups of alumni and students of KGP to pitch in front of institutional investors from Matrix Partners, Ankur Capital, Lead Angels, Ventureast and Vida Ventures and many angel investors as well.

The Panel Discussion witnessed Amod Malviya, Co-founder of UDAAN and Rajesh Yabaji, Cofounder and CEO of Blackbuck sharing their inspirational story about why and how they started up. The two stalwart KGP entrepreneurs with their deep experience and passion motivated the budding entrepreneurs.

The event culminated with the Networking Session where KGP entrepreneurs, Angels and VCs discussed the KGP start up scenario and the general market trends. Overall, it was a very enriching session for the emerging KGP entrepreneurs.

short_message: National Misson on Education through Communication and Information Technology (NMEICT), Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD) has awarded IIT Kharagpur
message:
National Misson on Education through Communication and Information Technology (NMEICT), Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD) has awarded IIT Kharagpur Phase-II of the project to develop a National Digital Library (NDLI). The project to develop a pilot for NDLI was also awarded to IIT Kharagpur which was completed well before the scheduled time. This is the primary reason why IIT Kharagpur was awarded the second phase. Visit https://ndl.iitkgp.ac.in / to register and have a look at the beta version of NDLI.

Phase-II of the project aims to develop the Pilot to a full-fledged NDLI with an aim to build a National Asset. This project will enable some key national knowledge discovery and immersive learning platforms built around the Digital Library. It will also encourage the entrepreneurial development of tools and apps around this platform. In its final contour, the system may serve as a pan-India virtual teaching-learning-evaluation-knowledge discovery and innovation platform, evolving as a key National Asset.

NDLI is getting structured along verticals like School, Competitive Exams and Career Development, Engineering, Medical, Law, etc. Under the Competitive Exams & Career Development vertical, NDLI is going to make available solutions (with explanations, alternate solutions, reference study materials and annotations) to all IIT-JEE Question Papers (since 2007) to benefit a large number of IIT-JEE aspirants.

The project is, thus, inviting applications from students who are currently in their 1st year of studies (Engineering, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics) and are willing to work as part-time Intern to prepare Solutions for JEE Question Papers. Suitable financial compensation will be provided.
The selection for the internship will be made by the PI/Co-PIs of the project and will be based on academic records.

Interested students must submit their particulars at https://docs.google.com/s... .
The applications will be considered till 23:55 hours, Wednesday, 11th February 2018.

short_message: Heartiest congratulations to the three recipients of Honda Y-E-S Award 2017-2018 from IIT Kharagpur. The award was conferred to Mr. Piyush Nanda, Department
message:
Heartiest congratulations to the three recipients of Honda Y-E-S Award 2017-2018 from IIT Kharagpur. The award was conferred to Mr. Piyush Nanda, Department of Biotechnology, Ms. Bindu Sancheti, Department of Chemical Engineering and Mr. Ayan Majumder, Department of Mechanical Engineering on 25th January 2018 after a four-stage selection process. Every year, the award is conferred to 14 students across 6 IITs. The objective of the award is to felicitate meritorious students in the field of science and technology.
Each Y-E-S Award recipient received US$ 3,000 (US Dollar Three Thousand only) in equivalent Indian Rupees and a credit-granting summer internship program offered by a Japanese company or research institute for two and half months.
An additional of US$ 7,000 will be granted for pursuing the internship in Japan.
For further information, please visit the site:
http://yes.honda.co.in /
An introductory seminar will be conducted next semester for the same.

short_message: The IU School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington provides a ten-week summer research program named IU-SROC (Summer
message:
The IU School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington provides a ten-week summer research program named IU-SROC (Summer Research Opportunities in Computing) . This is to attract high potential undergraduate students to do research in the fields of computer science, bioinformatics, human centered computing, computer vision, health informatics, security, cloud computing, Interactive Intelligent Systems, text mining and high performance computing.

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate student in an accredited university anywhere in the world.
Period: 8-10 weeks during the summer months of May through July.

Application Deadline: February 16, 2018

Application Material:

1. CV, highlighting top academic and research performances
2. An unofficial transcript from the college you are currently attending (an official transcript will be required once a participation offer has been accepted)
3. At least one letter of recommendation from a faculty member

Fellowship : $5000 + housing and a meal plan for this ten-week program

Description :This full time research experience includes work in the lab with a faculty and PhD student mentor, weekly professional development colloquia series and a technical writing workshop. At the conclusion of the program, all students participate in the IU Summer STEM Scholars research poster session and closing ceremony. Participants will have to prepare both oral and written summaries of their research projects.

For completing the entire application process please visit:

https://iu.co1.qualtrics....

short_message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but
message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but us who had taken this pledge long ago to make our country a better place not only in terms of lawfulness but also to achieve the transcendental goal of peace & harmony in the community which India comprises of. Our constitution is just a path towards building a good republic and with our honest intentions, we can constitute a healthy republic. Let’s commemorate the efforts of the historic intellectuals of our land in bringing out our nation to this level and put our efforts to head towards a better tomorrow.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Republic Day!

short_message: ‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations
message:
‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations unfolded with our honourable Deputy Director Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya hoisting the national flag followed by the national anthem sung in unison. The NCC wings marched thereafter along with NSS volunteers cheering up the celebrations. Professor S K Bhattacharyya also addressed the students and the guests in the programme. Kids from schools such as DAV, Kendriya Vidyalaya and Jagriti Vidya Mandir (JVM) depicted India's cultural diversity in their lovely performances. The programme also included a dance performance by students of Technology Dance Society (TDS) and a Nukkad Natak by students of Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS).
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a warm Republic Day.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 9 new photos — with Vishal Mahato and Arvind Reddy Bora.

short_message: Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India
message:
Technology giant Google has a mission to empower more and more people with internet access, thereby getting more people to sell to. In 2013, Google India started converting the 163-year old Indian Railways into a fibre optic network to bring internet to all. Today, the service has expanded to more than 150 stations across the country, with more than 7 Million monthly active users!
The man heading this project is Gulzar Azad, who has converted the idea of setting up a 45,000 kilometres wireless infrastructure, into a reality!
Catch him live during The Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018 from 2nd to 4th February.
#GES2k18

message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with Dr. János Pach from Hungary. He came here to deliver a lecture on combinatorics in Kshitij 2018. Currently, he is a Professor at Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University and EPFL Lausanne.
He has been awarded Alfréd Rényi Prize from the Hungarian Academy of Sciences and has also been elected as a fellow of the American Mathematical Society for his contributions to discrete and combinatorial geometry and to convexity and combinatorics.

short_message: Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members
message:
Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members from IIT Kharagpur seem to have finally found a solution for these clickbaits, that is, webpages with luring titles but irrelevant content. IIT-KGP's solution is a browser extension named 'Stop Clickbait' that can detect and block clickbaits with more than 90% accuracy. Following this up, they are working with Microsoft to assess the relevance of the revenue models of such advertisements.

The team has analysed linguistic patterns and complemented it with tracking news and twitter posts of different national and international media channels over several months to develop this extension which already has over a 2000 downloads.

Prof. Niloy Ganguly, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur says,
'Our primary aim is to offer a choice to the readers. If they like clickbaits, they are free to pursue them. If they don't like, our extension can come to the rescue.'

Read the complete article at:
https://m.economictimes.c...

short_message: Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep
message:
Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep Kumar Pani and Mayank Khetan, has qualified for the prestigious ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals. They showcased immense coding prowess to come second in ACM ICPC Amritapuri Regionals where 255 teams were battling for a spot in the finals.
In world finals, there will be around 130 teams eyeing for the ultimate top honours. ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals will be conducted on April 19, 2018 and will be hosted by Peking University and CYSCC: The Children and Youth Science Center of CAST (Beijing, China).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team and wishes them best for the finals!
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Sandeep Kumar Pani and 2 others.

short_message: IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development
message:
IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development of North-East through technological assistance. IIT Kharagpur has great capabilities in the Food Processing sector and has prepared the
ready-to-eat high energy food paste, which will be very beneficial for malnourished children between the age group of six months to six years.

The Agricultural and Food Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur demonstrated the initiative of the development of technology and machinery for the production of ready-to-cook iron-fortified rice premix which is fully compatible with those of normal rice, catering to India's anemic population.
A patent has already been applied for producing rice from broken rice kernels using extrusion technology.
The Rural Technology Action Group (RuTAG) unit, led by Professor PB Singh Bhadoria of IIT Kharagpur will be the coordinating center for this mission of technologies for the North-East.

'We are now planning for high-end value-added products including those from turmeric, ginger, etc, in collaboration with BARC,'
IIT Kharagpur director Partha Pratim Chakrabarti said.
Source- http://www.millenniumpost...

Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur witnessed the completion of a successful 6th edition of the Indian Case Challenge. ICC 2018 saw clashes of brilliant ideas and great solutions from over 1300 participants spanning all of India. The winning teams were :
1st position: Team Autospy, IIT Kharagpur
2nd position: Team SCMites, SCMS Pune
3rd position: Team Cryptocorrupt, IIT Madras

We congratulate the winning teams and thank all the participants who made the event a big success.

short_message: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and Nomura present guest lecture by Laxmi Agarwal, an Indian campaigner with Stop Acid Attacks. She is an acid attack survivor
message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and Nomura present guest lecture by Laxmi Agarwal, an Indian campaigner with Stop Acid Attacks. She is an acid attack survivor and speaks for the rights of acid attack victims. Currently, she is the director of Chhanv Foundation, a NGO dedicated to help the survivors of acid attacks in India. Laxmi received a 2014 International Women of Courage award by US First Lady Michelle Obama. She was also chosen as the NDTV Indian of the Year.

Be there on 26th of January, Kalidas Auditorium.

#Umang
#GuestLecture
#SpringFest2018
